column4: No, it's not pointless, this is a windows project, I just wanna use Ubuntu, now stop thinking about why, and think how, so how do I do this?
Do you want to cross-compile for Windows, or build a multi-platform app?
cross-compile I guess... My project can't find windows.h, and I want it to find it so that I can compile (forgot to add the name)
you'd use mingw
the MINimalistic Gnu c compiler for Windows
where do I get this?
If you're using Code:Blocks there's tutorials in their forums

looks like their site is down right now... say thanks to the Google cache: http://209.85.229.132/search?q=cache:NdNxupurZgwJ:forums.codeblocks.org/index.php%3Ftopic%3D3343.0+code:blocks+cross+compile&cd=1&hl=en&ct=clnk&gl=uk&client=firefox-a
ok thanks!
If you're in hurry maybe you should read the instructions I gave you earlier, and check out the mingw site as per the link it provides
So explore the Sourceforge project downloads lists until you find it then!
If I can find it in 30 seconds as I did, I'm sure you can!
